title: After divorcing his wife Minervina, Constantine marries Fausta, daughter of the retired Roman Emperor Maximian.
text: After divorcing his wife Minervina, Constantine marries Fausta, daughter of the retired Roman Emperor Maximian.

title: Bernard of Clairvaux preaches his famous sermon in a field at Vézelay, urging the necessity of a Second Crusade. Louis VII is present, and joins the Crusade.
text: Bernard of Clairvaux preaches his famous sermon in a field at Vézelay, urging the necessity of a Second Crusade. Louis VII is present, and joins the Crusade.

title: Queen Isabella of Castile issues the Alhambra Decree, ordering her 150,000 Jewish and Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity or face expulsion.
text: Queen Isabella of Castile issues the Alhambra Decree, ordering her 150,000 Jewish and Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity or face expulsion.

title: The city of San Cristóbal, Táchira is founded.
text: The city of San Cristóbal, Táchira is founded.

title: A sermon on "The Nature of the Kingdom of Christ" by Benjamin Hoadly, the Bishop of Bangor, provokes the Bangorian Controversy.
text: A sermon on "The Nature of the Kingdom of Christ" by Benjamin Hoadly, the Bishop of Bangor, provokes the Bangorian Controversy.

title: American Revolutionary War: The Kingdom of Great Britain orders the port of Boston, Massachusetts closed pursuant to the Boston Port Act.
text: American Revolutionary War: The Kingdom of Great Britain orders the port of Boston, Massachusetts closed pursuant to the Boston Port Act.

title: The massacre of the population of the Greek island of Chios by soldiers of the Ottoman Empire following an attempted rebellion, depicted by the French artist Eugène Delacroix.
text: The massacre of the population of the Greek island of Chios by soldiers of the Ottoman Empire following an attempted rebellion, depicted by the French artist Eugène Delacroix.

title: Commodore Matthew Perry signs the Convention of Kanagawa with the Tokugawa Shogunate, opening the ports of Shimoda and Hakodate to American trade.
text: Commodore Matthew Perry signs the Convention of Kanagawa with the Tokugawa Shogunate, opening the ports of Shimoda and Hakodate to American trade.

title: The United Kingdom establishes the Bechuanaland Protectorate.
text: The United Kingdom establishes the Bechuanaland Protectorate.

title: The Eiffel Tower is officially opened.
text: The Eiffel Tower is officially opened.

title: Malolos, capital of the First Philippine Republic, is captured by American forces.
text: Malolos, capital of the First Philippine Republic, is captured by American forces.

title: The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (later the National Collegiate Athletic Association) is established to set rules for college sports in the United States.
text: The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (later the National Collegiate Athletic Association) is established to set rules for college sports in the United States.

title: Serbia accepts Austrian control over Bosnia and Herzegovina.
text: Serbia accepts Austrian control over Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: The Vienna Concert Society rioted during a performance of modernist music by Arnold Schoenberg, Alban Berg, Alexander von Zemlinsky, and Anton von Webern, causing a premature end to the concert due to violence; this concert became known as the Skandalkonzert.
text: The Vienna Concert Society rioted during a performance of modernist music by Arnold Schoenberg, Alban Berg, Alexander von Zemlinsky, and Anton von Webern, causing a premature end to the concert due to violence; this concert became known as the Skandalkonzert.

title: The United States takes possession of the Danish West Indies after paying $25 million to Denmark, and renames the territory the United States Virgin Islands.
text: The United States takes possession of the Danish West Indies after paying $25 million to Denmark, and renames the territory the United States Virgin Islands.

title: Massacre of ethnic Azerbaijanis is committed by allied armed groups of Armenian Revolutionary Federation and Bolsheviks. Nearly 12,000 Azerbaijani Muslims are killed.
text: Massacre of ethnic Azerbaijanis is committed by allied armed groups of Armenian Revolutionary Federation and Bolsheviks. Nearly 12,000 Azerbaijani Muslims are killed.

title: Daylight saving time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.
text: Daylight saving time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.

title: The Royal Australian Air Force is formed.
text: The Royal Australian Air Force is formed.

title: The Motion Picture Production Code is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.
text: The Motion Picture Production Code is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.

title: An earthquake in Nicaragua destroys Managua; killing 2,000.
text: An earthquake in Nicaragua destroys Managua; killing 2,000.

title: A Transcontinental & Western Air airliner crashes near Bazaar, Kansas, killing eight, including University of Notre Dame head football coach Knute Rockne.
text: A Transcontinental & Western Air airliner crashes near Bazaar, Kansas, killing eight, including University of Notre Dame head football coach Knute Rockne.

title: The Civilian Conservation Corps is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.
text: The Civilian Conservation Corps is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.

title: World War II: Japanese forces invade Christmas Island, then a British possession.
text: World War II: Japanese forces invade Christmas Island, then a British possession.

title: World War II: A defecting German pilot delivers a Messerschmitt Me 262A-1, the world's first operational jet-powered fighter aircraft, to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.
text: World War II: A defecting German pilot delivers a Messerschmitt Me 262A-1, the world's first operational jet-powered fighter aircraft, to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.

title: The Dominion of Newfoundland joins the Canadian Confederation and becomes the 10th Province of Canada.
text: The Dominion of Newfoundland joins the Canadian Confederation and becomes the 10th Province of Canada.

title: Remington Rand delivers the first UNIVAC I computer to the United States Census Bureau.
text: Remington Rand delivers the first UNIVAC I computer to the United States Census Bureau.

title: Elections to the Territorial Assembly of the French colony Upper Volta are held. After the elections PDU and MDV form a government.
text: Elections to the Territorial Assembly of the French colony Upper Volta are held. After the elections PDU and MDV form a government.

title: In the Canadian federal election, the Progressive Conservatives, led by John Diefenbaker, win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.
text: In the Canadian federal election, the Progressive Conservatives, led by John Diefenbaker, win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.

title: The 14th Dalai Lama, crosses the border into India and is granted political asylum.
text: The 14th Dalai Lama, crosses the border into India and is granted political asylum.

title: A coup d'état in Brazil establishes a military government, under the aegis of general Castelo Branco.
text: A coup d'état in Brazil establishes a military government, under the aegis of general Castelo Branco.

title: The Soviet Union launches Luna 10 which later becomes the first space probe to enter orbit around the Moon.
text: The Soviet Union launches Luna 10 which later becomes the first space probe to enter orbit around the Moon.

title: American President Lyndon B. Johnson speaks to the nation of "Steps to Limit the War in Vietnam" in a television address. At the conclusion of his speech, he announces: "I shall not seek, and I will not accept, the nomination of my party for another term as your President."[1]
text: American President Lyndon B. Johnson speaks to the nation of "Steps to Limit the War in Vietnam" in a television address. At the conclusion of his speech, he announces: "I shall not seek, and I will not accept, the nomination of my party for another term as your President."[1]

title: Explorer 1 re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.
text: Explorer 1 re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.

title: The Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.
text: The Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.

title: The first WrestleMania, the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in Madison Square Garden in New York City.
text: The first WrestleMania, the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in Madison Square Garden in New York City.

title: Approximately 200,000 protesters take to the streets of London to protest against the newly introduced Poll Tax.
text: Approximately 200,000 protesters take to the streets of London to protest against the newly introduced Poll Tax.

title: Georgian independence referendum, 1991: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.
text: Georgian independence referendum, 1991: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.

title: The USS Missouri, the last active United States Navy battleship, is decommissioned in Long Beach, California.
text: The USS Missouri, the last active United States Navy battleship, is decommissioned in Long Beach, California.

title: The Treaty of Federation is signed in Moscow.
text: The Treaty of Federation is signed in Moscow.

title: TAROM Flight 371, an Airbus A310-300, crashes near Balotesti, Romania, killing all 60 people on board.
text: TAROM Flight 371, an Airbus A310-300, crashes near Balotesti, Romania, killing all 60 people on board.

title: Selena is murdered by her fan club's president Yolanda Saldívar at a Days Inn in Corpus Christi, Texas after accusations of Saldívar embezzling money from Selena's fan club.
text: Selena is murdered by her fan club's president Yolanda Saldívar at a Days Inn in Corpus Christi, Texas after accusations of Saldívar embezzling money from Selena's fan club.

title: Netscape releases Mozilla source code under an open source license.

title: Iraq War in Anbar Province: In Fallujah, Iraq, four American private military contractors working for Blackwater USA, are killed after being ambushed.
